what: Python for Data Extraction and Data Mining
column6: "Introduction to Python for first-year bachelor students. The course blended a MOOC with 5 remote discussion/practice sessions. I led the sessions for four groups of students out of seven."

Introduction to Python for third/fourth-year bachelor students from various departments. The course blended a MOOC with ~7 lectures and ~14 discussion practice sessions. I led the session for two groups of students.

what: Qualitative and Quantitative Research Methods in Psychology
why: From the syllabus: 'The course reviews the principal steps taken during a psychological research study and aims to provide students with the knowledge and competencies necessary to plan and conduct research projects of their own leading to M.Sc. dissertation and future scientific publications.' I led the discussion/practice sessions for the first-year cognitive science Master's students. The sessions combined the material from the lectures with a pretty much independent course on statistics using R.
Basics of digital signal processing: Fourier, linear filters, random processes. I led approximately seven discussion/practice sessions.
